author: andrica23
title: Decided to treat my phobia
body:
One day I have decided to treat my phobia and luckily I have met one of the best therapist which helped me session after session to be strong.  
I will never have enough words to say THANK YOU, Monica for everything.  
After my therapy I am much stronger than before and confident to do things which I thought were impossible.

title: Electronic prescription systems
body: the electronic prescription system, doesn't work for me. i have the problem for 4 years. each month for renew my medicine, i have to travel between gp and pharmacy several times. gp reception are saying we have sent your prescription to pharmacy and pharmacy are saying we don't recieve it. nobody care to solve the problem at gp.

title: Thank you...
body: Iv called for both myself and my daughter within the space of a week. My problems have been dealt with promptly and effectively via telephone consultations. The knowledgeable asthma nurse gave me fantastic advice and was very attentive and compassionate. The gp who also dealt with my problem gave me good time and also dealt with my problem in a compassionate way. Thankyou Petersgate, I understand the difficulties that you are facing currently, keep up the great work!

title: Amazing Service
body: Went in today for my first ENG 1 Medical Examination. Right from the start, my experience was brilliant. The recepcionist was very friendly and welcoming, and it made me feel very comfortable in my surroundings. Once I had got everything sorted for the Doctor, I went through and we went through everything for the ENG 1 (as per the MCA guidelines), but he was very reassuring, right from the get-go, that I would pass it no problems. It had been the biggest worry, and I was worried about nothing, it was a quick and painless service, and I shall return here for my next ENG 1, as well as all following! Thank you all so much.

title: Efficient service
body: Arrived with extreme lower leg pain, had bloods taken and then an ultrasound which showed Deep Vein Thrombosis. Had the problem explained and left with a prescription for the necessary medication. Thank you NHS.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great GP Practice
body: We have been registered at the GP practice for 30 plus years and has been instrumental in all of our care but in particular our mums care. The practice has worked hard to put measures in place to ensure we get a good service. I would like thank you all the staff from the Drs, to the nurses and reception staff for their friendly and supportive advice. Dr Rutton has been extremely helpful in managing mums care, she has amazing listening skills and we felt so confident about mums care plan. Thank you to Regina the nurse who took time over the phone to understand mums problems. Thank you the reception staff for organising the prescriptions. Fantastic service.

title: Great Practice
body:
I would like to thank everybody at this practice for their extra support and this difficult time.  Visited a few weeks ago and everybody was so kind and caring.  The infection control there was excellent and made me feel very safe.  
Well Done !

title: Outstanding Support
body:
I had to leave this review based on my time here over the weekend to deliver my beautiful baby girl. 
Regardless of any pandemic and circumstances the staff on labour wards and post natal ward were my constant support when my husband wasn’t able to be present and for that I will be forever grateful. 
You are all a credit to what you do and I will never be able to say thank you enough for keeping me calm and staying by my side when I was frightened or struggling.
I have done nothing but sing your praises since I’ve got home!

title: Amazing staff
body: I joined the practise last year and have nothing but praise for all the staff working there . The receptionists are amazing , so kind , caring , compassionate and dedicated . Nothing is too much trouble . The Drs are thorough and listen to you . My recent illness has been made that little bit easier from the kindness of the staff . Thank you , all of you

author: Razvi
title: Best midwives ever
body: Laura and Helen you’ve been amazing helping my wife to bring to life my baby boy. Very suportive, calm and positive. Thank you! ! !

author: Juny
title: My husband    mental health care
body:
My husband went into this hospital a few weeks ago and was in there about two weeks. He had taken ill again after 8 years of being healthy with no drugs, due to the stress of a family member being ill. Although diagnosed some years ago with Bi Polar Disorder we believed it was more of a lack of nutrition, vitamins and minerals and as said he was well for 8-10 years no drugs.  
Upon entering this hospital they put him on Olanzapine at the time it was questionable what the diagnosis was other than high stress. When I I had read up about the drug and that it could push his sugar levels up the answer was well we will give him a pill for that if that occurs? ? ? ? ? ? He came home and was doing well but had a relapse and mania was showing again due to high stress. This time they put him on higher doses of Olanzapine and monitored him. Then they decided to put him on Respiridon and they had him on both tablets citing that they had to put him on both to take him off olanzapine this took about a week.  
Then he had a Parkinson's shake because of one of the drugs and a rash, we don't know which drug caused this. So they put him on another drug to stop the shakes. All this time on messenger where I could see him he looked doped up but the doctor would not have it. I talked about bringing in a Nuitritionalist and they were ok about that but afterwards it seemed to make things worse for my husband.  
The following weekend staff said he was high, well in fact I thought he was subdued, when I mentioned I thought he was subdued I got ignored, I asked for the doctor to give me a ring again. They have not to date. Because staff thought he was high they would not discharge him and then have since put him on a mood stabilizer, all because some staff who do not know my happy, jolly, ebullient husband thinks he is high.  
I dislike the staff who are caring for my husband for they know not what they do. I believe nutrition is the way forward. But how can I implement that when he is in there. I am getting to know nothing, just getting ignored, I am not being brought into the decision making or any meetings either and I want to make a formal complaint against them all.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Classroom techniques
body: I needed to see a physiotherapist around June/July 2019 I got an appointment quickly however, on arrival I was stood 10 minutes waiting for someone to direct me to the correct area. When I got there I was in a classroom setting with 3 other people who had taken similar symptoms to me. We were assured we would be seen independently, which we were in a big room behind a curtain where everyone could hear everyone elses complaint then we sat and watched a video for an hour about muscles and were given a large elastic band and shown how to do exercises with it thank you see you later. Complete waste of time for me almost a year later pain is worse. Bring back the actual physical examination by a physiotherapist

title: First Class Service - Thank You
body: Visited Cath Lab as emergency during lock down. Everything was perfect. Consultant was very reassuring and explained everything fully before, during and after the procedure. He was supported by a friendly, welcoming and highly professional team. I would have no hesitation in returning to this Lab. Thank you.

title: Great practice
body: We have been registered at the GP practice for 30 plus years and has been instrumental in all of our care but in particular our mums care. The practice has worked hard to put measures in place to ensure we get a good service. I would like thank you all the staff from the Drs, to the nurses and reception staff for their friendly and supportive advice. The Dr we deal with has been extremely helpful in managing mums care, she has amazing listening skills and we felt so confident about mums care plan. Thank you to nurse who took time over the phone to understand mums problems. Thank you the reception staff for organising the prescriptions. Fantastic service.

title: Difficult to get through over phone
body: Each time, i call to the surgery, it's never easy to get through. Bell rings n rings then someone will put you on hold and then again it starts ringing then you are put on hold forever. Regardless if the call is urgent. This is very frustrating it also happens with other patients. Practice needs to sort this out.

title: non existent service no support in place
body: Been on the waiting list for years. No support in place. Left out on a limb. Sink or swim. Struggling alone. No one been in touch. I last rang to be told the service has now moved, but there is a physchology person taking calls, but was unavailable to take my call. I stopped trying to contact after my third attempt with this "person" whoever it is. I had not been informed of any change or location changes. Am I worth support? Clearly not in this service's opinion, regardless of being on a waiting list for years, with the story of severe lack of professionals , funding and staffing cuts, with long waiting lists. I need support. There is none. Ful stop.

readBy.name: North Staffordshire Combined Healthcare NHS Trust

title: It's news to me
body:
I called today to ask some questions to find all previous GPS gone and name changed etc. Asked why no information to patients told I should have been called????
But I find no appointments for a week that's not changed!!
I await to see improvement of it comes.

title: Great service always
body: Every time I need to make an appointment or emergency one they provide it or try they level best to get me one. From the doctors to the receptionist all are very patient driven and care and make you feel at ease and put they patient as priority. They take time and interest in what is the problem and get to solution. I would recommend this surgery and people should give back feedback as this surgery is only getting better each time I visit even at this current time over the phone as well. I would like to thank the doctor and staff there for doing the great job and in current situation thank u for still putting us first.

title: Thorough and Caring
body: I've always had good experiences with Lavant Road Surgery, the doctors are thorough and the receptionists are patient... during the pandemic I've tried to stay away to lighten the load when I've had concerns but when my son eventually needed treatment the Doctor we saw was so incredibly thorough and caring, talking me through everything and reassuring me which has been so important given current circumstances. Thank you for your continued work and support during lockdown! I am so grateful and so is my little man!! :)

title: Great Team a as
body: Would just like to say how helpful everyone is that work at this surgery. Had a telephone appointment with one of your nurses on 19th may at 9.30am and can’t tell you how much she put my mind at ease. Can’t praise your surgery enough . I urge If anyone needs advice please contact the team they really put your mind at ease don’t suffer in these difficult times . Thank you again stay well 🌈 Kerry Marsh

author: pyxismk55
title: My patient care
body: I recently spent 4 days in the Pembroke Ward recovering after undergoing a catheter procedure. I would like to praise the nurses on that ward for taking such good and professional care of me and it's quite clear that they all work so hard whilst on their shifts. I would also like to single out one nurse in particular, "Elizabeth". This lovely lady has a soft spoken but very reassuring tone to her voice. Elizabeth was always there to listen and was very proactive in that she would stop by just to make sure I was comfortable and didn't require anything else several times during her shift. I would like her outstanding professionalism to be recognized by the Hospital.

title: So professional
body: Today I contacted Pegswood surgery as I was having trouble ordering my husbands medication on line The young lady I spoke to was unbelievably patient with me I am not good with IT and she took me through every step without making me feel stupid or ignorant She was professional and treated me with respect thank you

title: Exceptional care
body: The practice have been nothing short of remarkable when it has come to my health and wellbeing. The reception staff are professional and helpful, and I always feel like my concerns are taking seriously. I have found all medical staff approachable, with one particular female GP going the extra mile. The surgery hosts a number of different services, which avoids going into the City Centre, and is always clean and pleasant. It is the best medical care I have ever received from a GP practice.

title: Very poor service
body:
With someone already suffering from anxiety and depression sadly this practice doesn’t seem to care about people. 
Very rude staff and always unwilling to help or consider how people are feeling yet they state.... they care! They really don’t 
Doctors should be there to support one through difficult times not make them worse yet every time I have to speak to this practice I end up feeling even worse than before.
They say they are here to help but when u need help there is no one to speak to and if u ask to speak to a doctor you won’t .... you’ll speak to someone else that is not a doctor and can’t really help!
It’s sad that I have to resort to this kind of feedback as doctors and surgery’s are supposed to be helpful and caring ... this surgery does not practice that theory. Your just a number 
If u want to make a change then my advice Would be to be to start caring about people as that’s what your job is supposed to be.
I don’t usually write reviews but I feel this information is helpful to anyone that wants to join this practice. If u want to feel that your cared about as a person and not just a number then maybe choose a different practice
Extremely unsatisfied and I will also be taking this matter further as it’s not the right to treat people this way. I may have an nhs id number but I’m also still a person with feelings.

title: Very responsive. kind and loving. A+
body: Amazing service. NHS is soooooo great and Binfeld has been super helpful. I called for a phone appointment and they called right back. Very kind and caring staff. Thank you

title: i love it
body: im very happy with my practice, receptionists are very kind and doctors very beneficial. my only concern is numbers of patients because it can be really really busy . overall i am very in love with my practice

title: Thank you for my care
body:
Admitted last Sunday with a minor stroke and left Tuesday after fantastic care and support. I though the hospital’s arrangements to protect staff and patients against Covid was excellent. Received excellent treatment Throughout, especially on acute stroke ward.
My thanks to everyone. You are true heroes in these difficult times.

author: corvustg37
title: Cardiology assessment hub
body:
Written communication was good  
It made me feel comfortable  
Nothing could have made it better

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Eemaan
title: My dad's experience of Solihull Hospital
body:
My dad who had Alzheimer's Dementia was admitted to AMU of Solihull Hospital in March after a neighbor complained about him and for some reason the police called paramedics. The staff in AMU were lovely. However he was transferred to ward 20B later on that night where things changed.  
Although some staff on the ward were lovely, the very next day nurses accused my dad of being aggressive on them trying to wash him.  
It was made clear to them on his admission that he would never go to the hospital, doctors or dentist; he was terrified of them, and he also wouldn't allow washes so they should have known this.  
He wouldn't allow a lady to wash him anyway. It's his dignity. He would say to me about me seeing a doctor "a man for a man; a woman for a woman".  
He would even look for me at home like a child looking for their mother to make sure I was still there with him, and no one was even offered by staff to stay with him and at night I would usually have to comfort him at home as he thought the bed was going to kill him frightened and he was in hospital all alone with people he didn't even know. It must have been very traumatic for him there.  
He should have just came home with me. If he had a slight infection, which was diagnosed by paramedics, I could have treated it as I always did. He should have just had a permanent catheter fitted (due to big stones he'd had in his bladder for some years) and then come with me but instead they made him stay there.  
Anyway on my arrival a nurse spoke to me terribly so I felt my dad wasn't being respected. He kept being chemically restrained with sedation (causing him to have low blood pressure and fast heart) and given antipsychotics both against family's wishes, from then onwards just for walking around and it seemed like them wanting to control him, claiming he was giving them an headache and thus he was missing meals and drinks because of it. But also it was being done even when no doctor was prescribing it.  
My dad had a drip fitted as he was slightly dehydrated yet the doctor removed it and refused to fit it back up as he told us that we wont force him to have something done that he doesn't want done, however as I was stressed and worried about my dad being left at the hospital I didn't think clearly at the time to tell them everything.  
As time went by my dad was allocated some carers, a night one which seemed really nice, then two others mainly on during the day, which pushed him about and then the one carer he had more often and they kept throwing my dad's sandwiches away I was buying him and showing a great disregard towards my dad's feelings and needs and even intimidating his visitors. Thy kept lowering his voice, almost in a whisper, to me and my sister saying -he should be medicated if the man in the next bed was your father you would care. And saying comments about how, he will fall down keep walking around and behaving in an intimidating way to us on our visits.  
Before the hospital went in lockdown I hadn't noticed my dad being given any food at all by any staff member, this was after he started to walk around eating sandwiches a kind nurse from another ward initiated to get him to eat, for some reason I could no longer see any food coming to him days before their lockdown, and I cried to my mom over the phone really worried about him, for him to be got out of the hospital however he ended up staying in there, with this carer in charge, and was discharged nearly 6 days later after their lockdown, almost 3 weeks stay in hospital, staff claiming he was fit to go.  
To me he seemed very poorly, having severe dehydration and malnutrition, clearly not being fed after their lockdown, dying. They may have on their records he was fed as it was written down wrong at least once before when I was visiting him and I had to correct a member of staff about it because they said he'd ate more than he had which I only realised when she came around to check his meal book. My brother who collected him even said he tried to drink a antibacterial handgel from the bottom of someone's bed because of his thirst.  
He sadly passed away at the beginning of April. He did not deserve such treatment and was kind to everyone outside of hospital, he would never hurt anyone. He will sadly be missed by everyone, friends and family, including those around Shirley, as many loved him.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: ophiuchusbp48
title: My time in Ty Llidiard
body:
I was admitted to Ty Llidiard in 2018 and was there under section 3 MHA for 4 months. I was treated for anorexia, anxiety with OCD tendencies and depression, and was heavily self harming at the time.  
Upon arrival I wasn’t told about the rules especially the rules about “rest”. Some of the staff were extremely rude towards me and during my admission I had a very bad experience with a certain staff member. They told me that I was just jealous of other people, that I was “attention seeking” and commented on my weight, bear in mind I was severely underweight and being treated for an ED. This person restrained me many times for feeds and when I told them it was too much and that I was in pain, they would ignore me and I had large bruises afterwards that staff said were just “because I was underweight”.  
The staff didn’t check up on patients as much as they should and I was able to engage in anorexic behaviours and attempt suicide whilst on the ward, meaning that the staff were not doing their jobs properly. However, the were staff who were very supportive and helpful including my Key workers and some of the nursing assistants. They saved my life and I’m forever thankful for that. My psychiatrist was very helpful and I am very thankful for everything that he did.  
Overall there are many things that the staff can do to improve to help the patients.

title: Great practice
body: I attended my regular appointment for my eye injection for macular degeneration. The procedure was excellent with regard to the difficult situation the hospital faces. My visit this morning was first class and I would just like to express a big thankyou to all staff.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brethlessness
body:
Went to A&E with breathlessness and had an ECG,
blood test, X-Ray and intravenous antibiotic all within 3 hours. Feel great now. Excellent service.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

author: Tudor Rose
title: hospital care.
body:
I was taken into Southport hospital last week with Corona-19 virus symptoms (I have a long history of mental illness). I was sobbing with fear.  
Ambulance arrived within ten minutes and the team were caring and understanding. A& E department was like being in Heaven's waiting room; I immediately felt calm and cared for. Everyone was rushed off their feet as usual, but that didn't prevent the nurses, doctors, admin etc. making me feel special.  
I was advised to stay in overnight until results came and was taken to ward 15A, Again, the love and care I received was excellent. I cannot praise them high enough. Being taken in during day I only had day clothes on. I was given a nightie, slippers and full toiletries. All patients are offered a menu with choice of meals. Food was nicely presented and tasted fine.  
My results arrived negative. Hooray. I stayed in three nights. God bless cleaners, chefs, kitchen staff, ambulance drivers/staff, care workers, nurses and doctors etc. *Occasionally an alien wearing a white space suit came to check on me. When I looked into their eyes I saw they were angels in disguise*.

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

title: A lovely welcoming reception.
body: I have had treatment for anemia ( blood tests and transfusion) and received excellent quick response and care ,and I cannot thank the nurses and reception enough ,especially at this difficult time for them ,I also had infusions on ward 20 which is also excellent, I highly recommend anyone to attend  thank you

title: Great team
body: All of the staff/team that I met were amazing. They helped with my anxieties over covid as my husband is shielding. They understood my concerns and put me at ease. During my procedure the doctor and nurse were really comforting and explained the process clearly. They were a very good team.

author: jellybelly
title: Amazing maternity care
body:
I had my little boy last summer and have never gotten around to thanking everyone who looked after us both.  
I opted to deliver in the midwives unit at AMH and was “booked” in for induction at T+12. I received excellent care from my community midwife Sandra throughout my pregnancy and was scanned at T+7 to check on my baby’s growth and amniotic levels.  
With each day over my due date, I felt more apprehensive as I was so overdue and no guarantee when I would be admitted for induction (the process being you were phoned as soon as a spaced became available and T+12 being the earliest date due to being low risk).  
I naturally went into labour early that morning and attended the assessment unit when my contractions were every 3-5 minutes. Unfortunately I was still in early labour and was sent home. After a few more hours at home I felt I wasn’t coping with my labour pains and contractions were less than every 3 minutes so we headed back in. Again I was still in early labour but the midwives reassured me I would not be sent home again. I was offered pain relief and we hired a tens machine. As my labour intensified I was given gas and air (my preference for pain relief) and a swiss ball. My baby was back to back despite my best efforts in the lead up to my due date.  
I was transferred to labour ward around teatime meeting the day staff. Unfortunately the midwives unit was full. My labour was still slow to progress and my waters were broken to help speed things along. I became hysterical as my waters were stained with meconium (baby had pooped), a sign of foetal distress which I was all too familiar with as a health worker. My baby was monitoring well and the staff tried to put me at ease that this is quite common when babies are over due.  
I had Senior charge midwife Jenny and staff midwife Michaela looking after me on the night shift who were absolutely amazing. It was decided the best thing for me was to have an epidural and hormonal drip as my cervix was swollen, slowing dilation and needed a chance to catch up. I hadn’t been keen for an epidural but my birth plan was “go with the flow”. I am so grateful to Jenny for being to the point with me and helping me agree to an epidural. Once the epidural was in place (big thank you to the anaesthetist!) I was able to think rationally whilst continuing with gas and air. I got some respite between contractions, my labour progressed and I delivered my baby naturally.  
The only feedback I have is that the seating for birthing partners in labour ward was limited and uncomfortable, and the waiting times/admission for induction process. A chair with arms for my husband and my mum who were my birthing partners to get some rest would have been amazing. They had a hard seat with no arms so were unable to get any rest for 20+ hours.  
Around my due date there was an exceptionally long wait time for induction which can’t be helped. The process for being admitted for induction amplified my anxiety. I felt very fortunate to have gone into labour without induction as waiting would have taken me even further beyond my due date.  
I can’t put into words the appreciation I have for all the care I received throughout my pregnancy. I will especially remember all the kindness and support from Michaela and Jenny. So much love for you guys! And again thank you all for everything.

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Hospice at Home Service
body: Sarah and Sidika have been a huge help for our dying mother.   They were very kind, gentle, professional and treated her with dignity and respect.   We have been extremely lucky to have such fantastic help.

title: Totally patient centred delivering treatment…
body: I cannot thank this team enough. I was left in so much pain with infection and swelling from a failed wisdom tooth extraction by my Dentist. The Dentist would not see me during Covid-19, when the swelling was nearing blocking my airway I went to A & E who referred my to the Max Fax team.  I got an appointment straight away and the Dr removed the rest of the tooth and root.  She took a biopsy to see if I had oral cancer.  It was a bloody procedure that required stitches.  All the team were extremely professional in administrating the care I needed. I will always be truly grateful to the team for being such brave and caring front line workers.

title: Obstructive receptionist and unclear on results
body:
My Partner had some tests for which he was told negative, no further action for which after making a subject access request collected copies of the results today. After looking at the results it stated some scanty growth of culture. He phoned the surgery today around 12.30 to get some clarification as to whether he did need treatment or if this was insignificant the reason being as I’m nearly 12 weeks pregnant and anything relevant could affect me. He spoke to a receptionist who was being quite difficult in answering his questions about the results and said she couldn’t see or read anything and the results he was reading from can’t have been from the surgery - my other half
Explained he just collected the print outs from the surgery! I tried to explain it clearer to the receptionist to which she said she can’t discuss it with me for which my other half then gave permission to talk to me but she still refused to listen. My other half then kindly suggested could he speak to a Dr - receptionist said fully booked and phone tomorrow. I asked about being fully booked when it’s only telephone consultations at the moment and explained we were extremely anxiously about getting clarity if there was an infection there as I was pregnant. She said try after 2 for a cancellation. I asked to talk to a manager when she said no manager in, I said is there a more senior person there she said no. My other half then asked to talk to Another receptionist we were more familiar with and she then cut me off and ended the call to which I was disgraced at. 
When we called the surgery back The receptionist who we knew answered and we explained everything from scratch and She arranged within 15 minutes for a Dr to call which they did.
The other concern we had was out of the two test results the first one had to be ‘repeated’ as the original dr said sample was unlabelled - even though we was adamant we had labelled it fully, then the second results came back negative. When speaking to a Dr today we was told first results showed scanty culture and second was okay. So was we originally told by the first dr it was ‘unlabelled’ when really something showed up ? We are none the wiser as we did not receive both results as part of our subject access request even though we asked for copies of ALL results. 
As a person who works in general practice I was very shocked with the attitude and vagueness we experienced and was so mad when I was hung up on! That is not something a receptionist should do. I know someone else has told me the receptionist put the phone down on her too recently and wonder if it is the same person???

title: Outstanding
body: I had my styloid bone removed and the care and professionalism of all staff involved was nothing short of amazing. I have recovered with no issues relating to the surgery. I was kept fully briefed on any problems that might occur but thankfully never did.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exemplary care with kindness
body: I would like to thank you for the care my elderly father received during his final few days before passing away earlier this month in Ward 5, Wexham Park Hospital.  We were obviously unable to visit but we talked with him frequently and he spoke about the great care he was receiving and kindness of the staff.  We spoke daily with the doctors/nurses looking after him and they were happy to provide updates on his condition without us feeling rushed.  When his condition deteriorated we were allowed to visit him, which turned out to be the day before he passed away and all the staff on the ward, including physios and orderlies, seemed to be aware we were coming in, helping us with our masks etc, and left us undisturbed to spend time with our Dad.  This meant so much to us.  We are extremely grateful for the professionalism, respect and kindness he received by all the staff.  An excellent representation of the NHS.

title: Great Service Excellent Doctors  & Staff
body: I needed an online consultation, called the surgery was given instructions what i had to complete to avoid coming into surgery and a telephone consultation would be arranged ..Absolutely brilliant service especially as i am currently shielding

author: atlasey65
title: Treated me with utmost respect.
body:
I was recently admitted to ward A22 with a suspected stroke.  
From my admittance to my discharged everything was handled in a very professional and cordial manner. Al the nurses in ward A22 treated me with utmost respect which makes you feel at home and very comfortable they clearly love their job.  
No patient could fault the care you receive in ward A22. the the Dr, Nurses and the dinner staff are fantastic. A double AA+ from me, a well organised team, a credit to Forth Valley Hospital.

title: Shockingly poor
body: This surgery is a joke, you can never get an appointment. My doctor said I was booked in for a physiotherapy session at Pinderfields for my back but I still haven't heard back and it has been absolute months now, and on my last visit a few month a go, the GP I saw was extremely rude, despite my clear instructions that she simply didn't stick to. Will be regestering elsewhere.

title: Brilliant Surgery
body:
I have in the past had cause to complain both verbally and written about Hall Green Health, however i feel i must congratulate the whole team on turning the surgery into the caring, supportive and helpful doctors surgery that we all have access to! You all do an amazing job with extremely quick responses to my online queries ( 2 in the past 8 weeks) even during COVID 19. 
I would have no hesitation in recommending this surgery, its fabulous. Stay safe everyone, I appreciate everything you do for us patients.

title: Easy to talk to
body: They always respond to the phone and booking online works just fine. Texting all details back is really helping a lot

title: Telephone Contact
body: Asked for a call back which I received that day. Triage member was very good, listened , discussed and made referrals as needed. Excellent

title: Amazing service
body: Best surgery in Luton. The reception staff are friendly and helpful every time I have spoken to them on the phone they really do try to help in any way even if I have been late ringing in they tell you where to go or who to speak to for help. I have seen two doctors there and both were brilliant really listened to the problems I had not trying to get me out of the room as quickly as possible. Great service

title: Over the moon with my nans treatmeant! Fantastic!
body: To everyone at queens, I cannot thank you all enough for the care my nan has received over the last few weeks, she went in to QUEENS hospital in need of emergency bowel surgery (right in the middle of a pandemic) we as a family can not praise you enough, I received calls at every stage of her care, I.E before she went into surgery, when she came out and any changes in her situation, unfortunately my Nan was extremely weak and very very poorly and was taken into intensive care (high dependency unit) where she changed from stable to critical condition quite rapidly, we received calls every single day and sometimes more,  keeping us continually updated in any changes and development she made. We are now on day 10 of my nan being in intensive care and she has made amazing progress thanks to all the fantastic staff! Today the nurses even done a zoom call so I was able to talk to my nan as she started to wake up. It has absolutely made my whole day and really reassuring at this scary time. This team have gone above and beyond for our family and the care my nan has received has been exceptional. From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU! You are true hero’s!

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: great department
body: i was well looked after by all the staff from when i went in to when my miner op was finished iwould like to thank all staff on endoscopic department for looking after me

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent  Care
body: Many thanks to my son's GP and nurse who have helped us get to the bottom of an injury he sustained over the past few weeks. This has involved several telephone consultations  and some.face to face appointments. They have really gone above and beyond, have been incredibly responsive and respectful of our views on the matter to help us move forwards. We now have a clear treatment plan for him.  We appreciate the pressure staff are under at present so feel that the care received has been an example of particularly good practice given the current context. Thank you.

title: Thank you Docking Ward
body:
Our mother is on Docking Ward and today (20 May) is her 100th birthday.  A cake was organised her by the ward
 and we have been able to Facetime her. Thank you to all staff on the ward for your kind care of our much loved mother who has 5 children, 8 grandchildren and 8 great-grandchildren.  Thank you also to all staff at the hospital for working so hard in these difficult times.  We clap for you every Thursday and are so grateful to you all.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: Brilliant practice from doctors to nurses to receptionist all very professional so helpful considerate keep up the amazing work

title: Excellent Coronavirus safety provision
body: I visited the Practice today for a blood test. They have set up an excellent system whereby I was able to stay in my car and two nurses in protective clothing came out to take the blood. It was an excellent example of the care and consideration that my wife and I have come to expect from this superb Practice. We have been with them for fifty years and the Doctors, Nurses, Technical Staff and Administrators have always shown exemplary professionalism, and have always been prepared to go that extra mile to provide the personal service that is vital in medical care. During these difficult times they have been in touch to ensure that we have any necessary medicines, and we have had telephone conversations with nurses running clinics that we have been unable to attend. I can not praise them highly enough, and thank them profusely for the excellent care that they have provide for our family.

title: Excellent treatment
body:
I would just like to thank all the staff involved in the Endoscopy Department of Kings Mill Hospital, my appointment today was part of my deferred surgical pathway for rectal cancer.
In our new environment of the coronavirus epidemic, the staff at Kings Mill truly professional & caring in every aspect of my time at the hospital.

Thank you

Phil Peat

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rude, dismissive healthcare.
body: The staff is unreliable, referrals are frequently lost. Prescriptions are often forgotten. Appointments never run on time. And the doctors have limited social skills. I cannot recommend this Practice to anybody. I am not treated with respect. Is this what you really want from a GP practice? The private patients are clearly prioritised over the NHS patients. The wait times can be very long. Sometines, appointments are only 2 minutes before you are abruptly asked to leave.

author: Madcat
title: My on going reflux.
body:
Hi I phoned my gp surgery today. to request a phone consultation for my on-going reflux situation.  
Due to the circumstances with this covid-19. to which I was told to tell the receptionist my details as it is confidential. So I did. To which I was told a doctor would phone me back.  
I didnt wait long. I spoke to the doctor I told them that I have had enough of this, the tablets that I take are no longer working and that I need something now. we spoke more as I have had scope done but there was no follow up.  
I asked why and doctor says there wouldnt be 1 as there was nothing serious. I then say ok, I am glad as only just find out.  
Anyway, doctor says, that theres a new tablet I could have/take. sorry I forget name of it. in that they would send prescription to chemist today for me to pick up. I asked the doctor this. as I need something to help me now. I phoned chemist twice in gp surgery only to be told my prescription was still in tray by the receptionist. to which I replied thats no good in there. as I was told it would be in chemist today. by the doctor.  
I asked the receptionist to go ask doctor why they would tell me this if this not the case, only to be told I will need to wait till tomorrow as person at chemist told me it usually takes or could take 48hrs. I'm not one for phoning my doctors all the time, but when I need help or advice and get misinformation that does not help. what if I needed this. right away? as well as being or having epilepsy. which I also have or had to ask every time I take any other tablets is it safe to do so.  
I feel I'm a bother. a nobody that matters. embarrassed. in that I'm begging for medication that I need. this is how I feel every time I have to phone my gp practise.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Marpm83
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Hospice kit facilitated family reunion in pandemic
body:
My Grandmother had cancer and was in her final stages. We really wanted her son from Switzerland to come and spend some precious times with her before she slipped away peacefully.  
He was not keen in coming due to Covid-19 but once we said that the Consultant from St Luke's Hospice had given us a kit he was somewhat confident in coming and he made use of this kit when he visited. This kit included personal protective equipment (aprons, gloves, face masks), hand sanitiser, mouth sponges and information for carers. His response, "An effective and beneficial goody bag".  
To be honest, I think it is one of the best kits I have ever come across in terms of protection. It had everything to keep him safe from all of us. The kit was somewhat generous such as it had a big bottle of hand sanitiser. I think this kit really needs to be promoted not just to hospices but other sectors.  
Thank you for giving us this kit, it really helped us as a family.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: cygnusqh75
title: My therapist really helped
body:
I can honestly say I would recommend six degrees  
My therapist really helped me. The sessions were really good and I started to feel better after the 3rd session but I went for the 4th for reassurance. Its nice to know I can come back to the service if I need to :)

author: jellybelly
title: Excellent care during an overnight stay
body:
After a choking episode at home we called NHS24 for further advise about attending A&E with our 9 month old. NHS24 sent an ambulance to take us to A&E.  
The ambulance crew were very kind and helped put us at ease. I believe they were from the Inverurie station.  
At A&E we were looked after by student nurses and doctors who assessed and observed our little boy. We were referred to ENT who felt the best course was to be observed overnight in the surgical ward.  
When taken up to the surgical ward at 8pm we were greeted by the night staff. Staff nurse Gemma and student nurse Erin who were looking after us were very supportive and welcoming. The girls made sure my little boy had some dinner and I a coffee as we had not had anything since lunchtime.  
A big heartfelt thank you to all the staff on surgical ward, student nurses in A&E, ambulance crew and ENT team.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: scorecardnw95
title: It has made me feel better in myself
body: Six degrees has made me feel better in myself. I felt listened to. After my therapy session I would use the tools my therapist recommended and felt this helped. I know if I start to feel low again I can access the service.

author: homamhx55
title: Covid-19 care
body:
My dad was admitted to hospital with sickness (gastroenteritis) due to his diabetes, he was on the mend and was in a room with 2 confirmed positive coronavirus patients even though he was a high risk patient. About a week later my dad also tested positive for coronavirus.  
Five days after he tested positive he was sent home (he lives alone) not knowing if or when he’ll be tested again. When sending him home they asked my sister who stays with my two elderly grandparents and 10 year old sister to take him home! Which would of potentially put her at risk. I am left very upset and disappointed at the care my dad received whilst in this hospital.

title: Impossible to contact by phone
body: Impossible to contact by phone. On the morning of Wednesday, the 20th of May, I tried to contact the surgery by phone in order to make an appointment to see a doctor about the pain I have in my leg. I tried from 8 am till around 1215, intermittently, to find that at all times the phone was engaged . No option of a queue to join, no option at all just engaged. It’s not the first time I’ve had this experience, it is always very difficult to obtain any contact with this  surgery by phone. It’s just not acceptable. God help anybody with a genuine emergency. I don’t believe this has anything to do with the Covid crisis, because it’s always been the same.

author: inclusiongg53
title: Homefirst Team
body: I had the hometeam care after being in hospital.   They cheered me up each and every day.   Not only did they see to my morning ablutions their kindness made them seem more like my friends.   I want the lasses to know that I really appreciate them and am grateful for the care given to me.   To carry on doing what they are doing is so much appreciated especially during this lockdown, they sometimes are the only people us elderly see.   thank you very much

author: casingtm58
title: Grateful for all the care from the team
body:
I had a stroke in January and after eight days in hospital was able to come home. Happily my husband is fit and well and able to help me where I needed help including putting in a second handrail.  
The Community Stroke Team arrived on the next day and my treatment which was first class went on from there. I was seen three times a week by various members of the Team including Emma, Jasmine, Jan and Gapele. They were all very kind and caring and very professional. Luckily for me I was ready for discharge at the time of the Corona Virus. I am now almost 100% recovered, able to walk 10,000 steps each day! I am very grateful for all the care from the Community Stroke Team.

author: hekaxm86
title: The care and dignity they gave to my husband
body:
In April my husband William was admitted to St. Lukes.  
Following 2 spells in hospital (he was diagnosed with chronic heart disease, not Covid-19), he was nursed by his wife at home for 4 weeks before it became apparent that he needed more intensive palliative care.  
St. Luke's settled him into a bright room which opened onto a beautiful garden and then he was assessed by a caring doctor. Every day he was washed, as well as once even shaved. The nurses turned him several times a day to make him more comfortable. All this with tremendous care and very good humour.  
William had severe breathing issues and could no longer take solid food, just a little water. He fought so hard to live but eventually the fight was lost and, 8 days after arriving, my Love & my Life, finally passed.  
Once again, the staff were tremendous. They provided sympathy, comfort and a lot of tea in my hour of need.  
I thank everyone at the hospice from the bottom of my heart for the care, and most all, the dignity they gave to my husband of 35 years in his final days.  
I believe that hospices are hugely undervalued, after all who wants to contemplate their loved ones ever needing this kind of care, let alone consider ever needing it themselves.  
But should that day come, please remember that St Luke's is only 40% funded by the government, the rest is made up by fund raising and donations and without hospices like St Luke's the world would be a much more difficult place for the terminally ill and their carers.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great Care
body: I have been having cancer treatment since January 2020, and Oaklands have supported me through this. Regular GP appointments (by phone) and all the staff are so helpful and kind. Just being kind is one of the greatest things they could do for me, and I thank them and appreciate them.

title: Using e-consult
body: I used e-consult yesterday (for the first time) and thought that the response time and advice, plus the request to attend the surgery, was first rate. I felt privileged to have been seen and advised by your doctors and staff. Thank you so much to everyone. And just to add that I have always found the surgery 100% responsive and helpful.

title: Calmness
body: Sunday appointment. Quiet time. Very clean looking area. Staff calm and well kitted with ppe very reassuring.

title: Great efficiency
body: Calm, reassuring,gentle staff.  Dealt swiftly with my toe injury, amazing, especially considering the pressure all must be under. Thank you.

title: excellent practice
body: During the Covid 19 outbreak i contacted my doctors with covid symptoms. The reception staff  were very professional and courteous and said a doctor would telephone me. A doctor contacted me within 30 minutes and went through my symptom, deciding I should isolate and get a test as soon as possible. Over the next three weeks, i had three further telephone conversations and was given reassurance and the latest advice in relation to covid 19. The last conversation was initiated by the practice to check up on me and to decide if I needed further investigation into my issues. Throughout the process, the doctors and staff were amazing and I cannot praise them highly enough for their knowledge and care. An excellent practice!!

author: MJSK1985
title: Campbeltown Maternity Unit
body:
The care we as a family have received from Campbeltown Maternity Unit over the last 9 Months has been phenomenal. There were stressful moments when it looked as though I wouldnt be able to deliver here and of course the restrictions of Covid 19. The thought of having to deliver elsewhere broke my heart. I'm a born fighter and wasnt prepared to accept I had no choice. My wonderful midwife arranged a consultant appointment for me with the Consultant I had seen when I had complications after my first labour. A plan was put in place to allow a local delivery on the understanding that if complications arose I would be transferred.  
Towards the end of March i was experiencing light cramping as the cramps become more rapid it dawned on me they may actually be contractions. We phoned the on call midwife and were advised to go to the Unit, we arrived around midnight. The two midwives on call were Helen & Charlotte. Around 1am my cramps intensified and felt like proper contractions. I asked for gas & air and after an examination my waters broke.  
The team knew I wanted to use the pool so Charlotte set about filling it. However our baby girl wasn't prepared to wait she made a very rapid appearance and was lovingly delivered by Helen around 2.30am  
I honestly can't fault the care we received in labour and feel so blessed to have a wee Campbeltonian ( even though she was 9lbs 3)  
My experience of labour here was amazing and Im still a bit overwhelmed by how amazing it was. We look forward to being looked after by these wonderful ladies again in the future when 2 hopefully becomes 3 .  
Special mention has to be given to how well the midwives have supported all the parents to be in the town during the uncertainty of Covid 19 .  
I'm sure they themselves have at times been scared & worried for their own families .  
Yet they have gone above & beyond for each and every one of us.  
Forever grateful

author: Suecw96
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Ward Activities
body:
Burne Ward, Rampton. During COVID restrictions Therapy and Education staff are delivering activities on the wards. Here are some comments from patients on Burne Ward:  
PatientQuotes:“TED staff are amazing!” “I really enjoy your company”“You’re doing a good job” “I like thesocial aspect of the activities”“Your team are like a silver lining in a cloud” “You’re really positive!”“I feel grateful for you coming onto the wardevery week” “I like all the activities and going on freshair” “I enjoythe quizzes”“Staff are really nice & polite” “Your sessionsare really beneficial”“If you didn’tcome onto the ward we wouldn’t be able to do as much”

title: Quick service
body: Got seen quickly, Doctor did scan and gave results, told me findings and nothing too worry about, would have appreciated him telling me why i had a fatty lump with connective tissue..

author: camelopardaliskp79
title: An adventure instead of an upheaval
body: The move from Cambridge to Carlisle was effortless and over within 2 days, or at least it was for the patients. We caged all our belongings and off they went before us then after dinner on the Sunday we were all took up the stairs to Carlisle and just emptied our cages in our pre determined tooms. The staff had obviously done this before, as you could tell from their efficient way of doing things. It made what could have been a stressful, hard work and upsetting time into an opportunity to see the hospital from a different perspective. The patients now dealt with it as an adventure instead of an upheaval and some have started saying they hope we may stay here for good.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: authenticgf98
title: Together we found ways of helping each other cope
body:
Struggling with anxiety prior to this service. Husband & daughter finding it hard to cope. IRIS Team came in early February '20 started me with routine & positivity. Together we found ways of helping each other cope with the situation.  
Good advice given by all attendants, positive feedback at every stage. The support at the time was valuable and well received.  
I am now on the mend thanks to your help. However, there is still a way to go and we are still using a self help course on CBT and using the daily diary to record feelings.  
Thank you to everyone who helped me. Much appreciated.

author: slidehy74
title: The move went as smooth as it could
body:
Staff worked hard. Was very supportive too. The move went as smooth as it could.  
What I will say is the floor in my room is that I dont like my room!  
Otherwise I am well and feel safe & secure on my new ward. I commend staff for coming to work and helping especially in the Covid 19 stages.  
Thank you  
Cambridge moved to Carlisle

title: Great practice and professionals
body:
The staff and the doctors at this practice are incredibly friendly and helpful.
Ive been registered with the practoce for some time and i must say their knowledge and professionaliam is fantastic.
Ive never had trouble getring an appointment and everyone is very accommodating.
Its lovely to know that they are willing to go the extra mile for their patients.

author: Chats
title: Poor Treatment by Midwife
body:
My wife had a midwife appointment at Wycombe hospital today. When she got home she was very upset because she felt as though the midwife had treated her like a piece of work that she had to get through and as though the appointment was a tick-box exercise, rather than checking how she and the baby are doing. Not once was she asked how she was. It would have made the world of difference if the midwife had taken two minutes to show an interest and to show that there was someone in the healthcare system who cared about her wellbeing, but that didn't happen.  
What makes this even more disappointing is that it is really tough for pregnant women and their families in lockdown because they are only able to receive a very limited amount of support from friends and family.  
It is also Mental Health Awareness week, something that has clearly passed this particular midwife by, and even more of a reason for someone just to ask how my wife was doing. This is the second time my wife has seen this particular midwife and the treatment was the same last time.  
It is a real shame that my wife had to experience this because when we had our first baby, the staff at Stoke Mandeville were superb and when we have been on the paediatric ward everyone has been amazing.

author: Mary A
title: My treatment and staff
body:
I was taken ill at work in April  
Paramedics arrived and quickly and got me to A&E  
I had gone into complete Heart block by the time we had arrived the whole team worked extremely hard and I was given CPR 3 times my organs failed but they fought and brought me back I was put on a ventilator and dialysis and taken to ICU when I was woken up 2 days later the Drs nurses and everyone were amazed I had pulled through and didn’t have any kind of brain damage.  
I continued my stay for the next10 days I cannot thank all the team that helped me enough I would not be here today if it wasn’t for you all .  
I am also very honoured that you asked me if you could use my records for training purposes which I am happy for you to do especially if it helps save more lives  
I am forever in your debt Thankyou all again the NHS are amazing people all of you are so dedicated to what you do.  
Thankyou again

author: JW3010
title: Maternity Services in Moray
body:
My little boy has just turned 6 weeks old and I would like to extend my thanks to the wonderful team of midwives we encountered. My community midwife was Lorraine from the Buckie, Keith and Cullen Team and it was like a reunion with an old friend as she had cared for me 4 years prior with pregnancy one. The obvious big change from last pregnancy was the loss of obstetric backup based in Dr Grays Hospital. I was lucky enough to have had a straight forward pregnancy last time was happy to book with Ward 3 on the basis of the positive experience I had encountered there before. Lorraine organised all the routine scans and conducted her routine antenatal care in her usual friendly and reassuring manner sometimes with a student midwife or return to practice midwife present benefiting from her knowledge and experience.  
The scanning midwives were skilled and patient as my little boy was a bit camera shy on both occasions but they took the time needed to get the information required allowing me to drink more water and move around rather than reschedule appointment when I had already swapped shifts at my work to be there.  
Then came corona virus and all the necessary changes to service provision that came with it. My last antenatal apppointments were over the phone until I was over my dates. I was anxious to do anything to avoid having to go down to Aberdeen for an induction and especially with the new and necessary restrictions in visiting. Aberdeen was also a good 60 miles away for me, I had a 4 yr old at home and it was spring time - one of the busiest times in the year for my farmer husband. Also, with the country in lockdown this added extra pressure of whether I would have childcare for our 4 yr old or whether I would have to go through the labour on my own.  
Lorraine saw me at around midday and performed a sweep to try and encourage labour to start and organised post dates scan and induction in case it was required. Fortunately, she worked her magic and I went into ward 3 later that night. The timing was perfect as my 4 yr old was in bed oblivious and our farm worker slept in the spare room at home to be there for him if required. In ward 3 I was met by Midwife Rebecca. I was disappointed in myself that I wasn't as far through the first stage as I thought (or hoped) but Rebecca was quick to remind me that this baby was coming and would be born tonight and that she anticipated that labour would progress quickly from here. She was right (I should have asked her for the lottery numbers when I was in) and was helping me through to the delivery suite about an hour later. She was kind, supportive and kept me going with some added humour and was in control when I was at the stage where I no longer knew what to do with myself and no doubt talking rubbish on the entonox. She called for another midwife when delivery was imminent and Midwife Fiona appeared. She was brilliant too. A calm and reassuring presence who encouraged me over the finish line. She took the baby and did his initial checks while Rebecca was left with a bit of stitching up to do. She did this quickly and skillfully and everything healed with no problems. They also made the best coffee and toast! Husband was back home for a sleep and then able to wake our firstborn to the news he had a wee brother.  
The next morning midwife Deborah came on shift and did all the usual post natal checks for both me and my baby efficiently even while getting used to the new PPE guidance giving us the green light for discharge home. Follow up with Lorraine and her colleague Kirsty for a weekend visit ensured that initial breast feeding hurdles were overcame.  
We are grateful to all these amazing ladies for their expert care which we were lucky to have locally. They provide an excellent service in challenging times in a challenging location and are to be applauded!

author: Giles
title: The Bowen Technique
body:
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
[Very happy with 'Team work']  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']  
[Very happy with 'Treatment']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: nervous older nurse
title: Gynaecology outpatients clinic appointment
body:
l received my Gynaecology OPA after getting referred from my GP , l did think due to the Covid 19 situation , clinic appointments would be suspended . So when l recieved mines really quickly , l was a bit apprehensive and nervous to attend, thinking the worst case senario  
But on arriving my fears went right out the window , Michelle the ANP was lovely as were the other 2 nurses. She explained why l was there , what was going to happen and then what every step of the procedure was and what my options were post procedure.  
After the procedure , she gave me contact numbers , email address etc if l had any questions . l cant thank her and her team enough for all their help and reassurance today , they made me feel at ease throughout the appointment. As an nurse myself l know how important it is to make the patient feel at ease and they certainly did that  
huge thank you again

author: KM2207
title: Ward 119 staff were warm and compassionate
body:
I was recently a patient in ward 119 at RIE. After spending nearly 5 days in the ward after having an elective c-section I have nothing but praise for the fantastic staff who work there. The care both myself and my son received was beyond amazing and completely reassured me after a previous negative birth experience.  
The staff were warm and compassionate, they were happy to assist with all aspects of care and made me feel relaxed especially when my partner was not able to visit.  
I enjoyed the peace and certainly felt more relaxed with the current set up of visiting. The staff spent time with me and I truly felt ready for discharge when the day came. At no point did I feel rushed to leave and really couldn't have asked for better care.  
All the staff are amazing and they have made a very scary time one of the best experiences of my life! Thank you.

author: Wishaw Heroes
title: The care, compassion and professionalism were second to none
body: We recently had to take our 1 year old to ED as he fell and burst his cheek. The fear and panic I was overwhelming knowing I was taking him into a Covid hot bed. From walking in the front door, the care, compassion and professionalism were second to none. Particularly Nicola. I cant thank them enough for how well they looked after not only my little boy but my husband. They made a traumatic experience for all more relaxed. I will truly always be thankful to our NHS heroes and the ED department at Wishaw deserve praise for what they do day in and day out.

author: mabellinaballerina
title: Peer to peer group discussions
body:
I commenced the online peer to peer groups with Marios about 3 weeks ago. Prior to attending the online group, I was apprehensive, wondering what information will be shared. I was also worried about showing my face, but realizing actually if I didn't, I would not have had the same experience.
The people in the group are from all walks of life and what is fascinating is the non judgmental aspect of the meeting. It was really useful and really gave me strength and almost come off the session and more relaxed and calm.
Mario is an excellent host. He makes people feel at ease, encourages respect and open conversation. I look forward to actually attending these sessions and feel I come further with each one.
Thank you for your support.

author: Emmrd63
title: A great support to the patients you advocate for
body:
Hello Julie  
I just wanted to feed back to you once again how thankful AE was with all your support during her complex discharge planning, as you’re aware she required an advocate as she felt her family were not supporting her with her wishes and feelings.  
A was extremely thankful for all your time and effort in keeping in touch via phone call e-mail & skype during these difficult times, she has consistently told me she had full trust in you as an advocate and felt you were “fighting her corner”.  
As a DLN I would also like to thank you for all of the support you have provided patients on my caseload. By the very nature of my role and referrals I receive patients can be extremely complex with very difficult family dynamics working alongside you is a great support to both myself and the patients you advocate for.

author: Clova
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My stay here
body: I have found the care here to  be excellent. Dont like being moved from one ward to another. I find it difficult initially when my routine is changed. But I have been able to adjust. Not having visitors is not bothering me as I have very few visitors at home.

author: Nicki88
title: Addiction to codeine tablets
body:
I was put on co codamol tablets for my migraines 5 years ago, at first I was ok only taking them when I got a migraine and they worked so well, I don’t know how it started exactly but over time I loved the feeling codeine tablets gave me. I was always happy they would help me to sleep and make me more confident in life.  
After 2 years my sister finally noticed my addiction and she rang the doctors, which I was then made an appointment to see a doctor and she put me on anti depressants and just told me to stop taking codeine, I did try I managed a year without them, but then I started again but this time it got worse.  
I was taking 32 tablets within 2 days. I would get angry and agitated if I never took them, I started having therapy for my anxiety which then I told my story of addiction to my therapist, she then referred me to cgl which I wasn’t going to go at first as I didn’t think anyone could help me and didn’t want anyone taking my happy pills away from me, but I was so worried about the damage it was causing to my body. I was also so numb everyday I was in a world of my own, so I went to my appointment with cgl, and they was great.  
It didn’t take long before they put me on a plan to help me ease of the codeine tablets I always thought I was weird that I was addicted to tablets I thought I was the only one until I started reading up and was amazed there was so many others like me that was addicted to codeine and couldn’t see a way out, so I’m now on espranor tablets I take 10mg a day And they're working great.  
The first 2 weeks I was sick but I couldn’t believe that I wasn’t even thinking of codeine tablets once on espranor, it’s been 5 months now and I haven’t had any codeine I haven’t once thought about it either and I’m such a happier person. I didn’t realise what damage it was doing to me I didn’t even recognise myself I was numb everyday didn’t speak to anyone, always tired, I am so thankful to the cgl team they have been great, even call me once a week to see how I am and just for a chat.  
I’ve also found another way to control my migraines and would never touch a codeine tablet again they ruined me and are just so addictive, I urge anyone that can see there getting addicted to get help straight away, I was a lucky one my blood tests came back ok but my insides could have been damaged a lot more if I would of carried on or I could have overdosed myself, a big thank you to cgl they work so so hard and are there to help anyone who has an addiction, they act more like there your friend than doing a job,

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: bagpuss36
title: COVID 19
body: I was told to self isolate by my previous job as I used to work in a prison. I felt really bad with it and was worried so phoned 111. The call handler I spoke to was very polite and helpful whilst being efficient. He put my mind at rest.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

author: Clova
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care has been excellent
body:
The care here has been excellent there isn't anything that could make it better. The visiting restrictions I find tough. I find this time with the virus is unreal yet I have lived through the 2nd world war and all the difficulties that brought. I miss seeing my family. I can telephone them on my mobile everyday. They have posted in pictures and my great grandchildren's drawings. That was lovely.  
I pass the time watching TV and reading. The food is good and varied.

author: Lees09
title: Trying to get a second opinion
body: In November 2019 I had a Hip Replacement Surgery at BMI Ross Hall, Glasgow. The replacement went ok but a Fermol Nerve was damaged and over stretched. I have to wear a knee brace to support my knee. I have Osteoarthritis in my knee is swollen and sore. While I know this can't happen just now, I am wondering how to eventually get a second opinion.

author: Georgee1234
title: Ocd intrusive thought and aniexty
body:
I have struggled with ocd for many years and suffered with very low self esteem and intrusive thoughts.  
I felt so low and alone scared and really out of control of my own thoughts. I felt trapped and like I was a bad person I used to best myself up daily and mentally torture myself.  
But at Bromley Healthcare, I felt safe in my sessions with James

author: blackbirdmb84
title: Rheumatoid arthritis
body: I suffer from rheumatoid arthritis 23 years now. affecting most joints it's also affected my lungs and heart I attend gartnavel general hospital Glasgow under care of Dr hunter and Dr porter both of them are the best doctors consultants on the planet so caring and helpfull

author: SPW
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The paramedic said she did not need to go to hospital
body:
A lady that I work with rang an ambulance at approx 8am. The crew arrived and one of the paramedics came across as arrogant an uncaring and stated that she did not need to go to hospital. She stated that the paramedic wrote her stats wrong on the paperwork and left. Leaving her feeling panicked and really distraught.  
I spoke to her and suggested we rang her GP who unfortunately wasn't able to offer a telephone consultation until 3.30pm.  
The GP themselves rang an ambulance as they knew she was quite unwell.  
It later transpired that she had had a heart attack and was kept in hospital for 5 days.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: marsny38
title: Anxiety
body: I felt desperate. My emotions were out of control. I couldnt focus on anything. The aniexty was affecting every aspect of my life. But since having counselling I have realised my self worth. I've realised that I took people's comments very personally. Depression has lifted. And my self confidence is coming back. I am finding myself again as I was totally lost. I cant thank claire enough for her time encouragement & support over the past 3 mths. With her help & support I am slowly getting my life back.

author: Relative dismissed
title: Missing deceased belongings
body:
My mother was admitted to KGH at the beginning of May 2020 for a period of 2 days before she sadly died.  
The staff have lost her personal belongings, including her clothes, dentures and a sentimental gold necklace with a crucifix on that she never took off.  
Proceedures were not followed regarding listing patient's valuables. The staff were negligent with her personal belongings. When attempts were made to contact the wards involved everyone shirked responsibility, we were even made out to be lying! We were treated with contempt, and laughed at, certainly not how you're expected to be treated, especially not when mourning for a loved one gone so suddenly.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Sewfine
title: What a lovely lovely girl and so suited to her job title
body:
Upon arrival I was greeted by the loveliest blonde lady , I think Linda , who made me feel completely at ease .  
I was so worked up thinking I was wasting NHS time ...  
I was them met By Staff Nurse Carol Ann who was also incredibly kind and amazing !  
What a lovely lovely girl and so suited to her job title .  
My care was 1st class and I cannot thank both girls enough for there care  
Carol Ann you are amazing , thank you again so so much for your Kindness and concern...  
I have broken my shoulder ...  
I will be most definitely be sharing my story ...  
I LOVE THE NHS ....

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: BB08
title: I truly couldn’t have asked for a better birth experience
body:
After reading another positive “review” on here, I wanted to share my experience too. I felt really listened to and informed my whole pregnancy and supported in my choices by my midwives Kate and then Rosie. Kate helped me feel empowered to choose what was best for me and to know my rights.  
Rosie provided continual care as well as yoga and hypnobirthing and was very caring and supportive when I got a bit upset after speaking to the obstetrician whose words unintentionally had me doubting my own decision making skills. She took me through my previous birth minute by minute which was exactly what I needed. In the end I am so so thankful to have been able to give birth in Oban hospital - it was a healing experience and took away that lack of control and doubt from my first birth. Miaread was incredible in her unflappable, unobtrusive and intuitive support during labour. The nurse who put in my cannula (though I wasn’t able to speak to her by this point) was also really calming and friendly and helped turn around something I was initially afraid of and reluctant to do. I truly couldn’t have asked for a better birth experience and never thought I would get the gentle and empowered experience that I did.

author: AnneG
title: Support Phone Calls during Covid
body: My mum had been attending choir and tai-chi at the hospice before going on the 12 week out-patient programme which she absolutely loved. Covid interrupted this but staff continued to call once a week. During the first 7 weeks of lockdown, mum lived with our family but as her care needs increased dramatically she sadly had to be placed in care. This has been a roller-coaster of emotions for all of us and the calls from staff at the hospice were welcomes. Staff understood and empathised and this was invaluable at times. Thank you for your care.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum
